oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military uniforms; Military personnel; Military officers
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Civilian Conservation Corps 1937 Yearbook image of Colonel George Dillman, Commander of the 6th Cavalry Regiment and the District Commander of "C" District of the Civilian Conservation Corps, Fourth Corps Area
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Civilian Conservation Corps in Tennessee Collection, 1933-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Colonel George Dillman, a career military officer who served during WWI, took command of the 6th Cavalry Regiment on May 4, 1937, and assumed command of Fort Oglethorpe and "C" District of the Civilian Conservation Corps on June 13, 1937.; This volume of the "Official Annual of the Civilian Conservation Corps, 'C' District CCC, Fourth Corps Area, 1937" was donated by James O. Rickman, Johnson City, TN, who was with Camp Cordell Hull, Co. 1455, F-5.
